Dear Ms. Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your
contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (989) 758-2717.

ALLEGATION: Staff 1 pushed Youth A against a wall causing a bump to her
head. She has two scratches and an open sore below her knee.
INVESTIGATION:
On 9/20/22, I spoke to consultant 1 for update on patterns and trends in the agency.
On 9/20/22 spoke to Complainant 1. Complainant 1 did not report any new details to the
allegations other than she is currently working with Youth A on what are truths and what
are lies. Complainant 1 reported Youth A lies often and creates stories.
On 9/20/22, I spoke to DHHS Worker 1; allegations and scheduling was completed.
DHHS Worker 1 saw Youth A face to face and verified that Youth A had an open sore
on her leg, but it was from picking an old scab.
On 9/20/22, a phone call and email was completed to Administrator 1 requesting
documents for the investigation.
The following documents were reviewed throughout the course of the investigation:
• Incident Report
• Personnel files
• Medical documents
• Documentation Policy
• Staff 1 Performance Evaluation
I reviewed the video of the incident on 9/27/22. The incident occurred on 9/11/22
at 8:15pm:
Youth A was in the entrance of her doorway. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were with her. Staff 1
pushes Youth A twice. Staff 2 is standing and watching. The video did not show the
inside of the room; therefore, it was undetermined how Youth A hit her head.
I reviewed the Incident reports for 9/11/22.
The first incident report noted the time of incident was at 8:40pm. Staff 2 wrote the
report. Staff 2 did not report that Youth A was pushed in the incident report. Staff 2
3

wrote: “staff helped her inside her room. [Youth A] began kicking the door and lost her
balance ending with her tripping over the basket of sheets causing her to hit her head
on the wall.”
The second incident report was written by Staff 1. Time of the incident was documented
as 8:40pm. Staff 1 does not report that she pushed Youth A into her room. Staff 1
reported, “I then assisted her back in her room and closed the door. Youth A started
kicking the door and lost her footing and tripped over a basket and hit her head on the
wall.”
I reviewed the Hurley Medical Documents:
Diagnosis was hematoma of scalp. The instructions from the hospital were to provide
Motrin or Tylenol as well as an ice pack on her head.
I reviewed Staff 1’s Performance evaluation dated 1/25/22. Staff 1 received 2 out of
4 ratings for the following:
• not reviewing safety plans or ICMPS consistently
• professionalism with children and staff (management has addressed these
issues)
• she actively asks questions concerning policies and procedures…sometimes
Staff 1 doesn’t know what to do in quick crisis so she will ask for help until she
fully understands
I discussed disciplinary action of Staff 1 with Administrator 1.
Staff 1 has received a written warning on 11/22/21 for leaving while a crisis was
occurring.
Staff 1 received a memo when she did not use de-escalation techniques outlined in TCI
(Therapeutic Crisis Intervention) and grabbed a phone out of a youth’s hand.
**It is to be noted that Staff 1 was terminated on 9/21/22 due to having ten attendance
points.
Staff 2 did not have any disciplinary action in her file.
All interviews were conducted by telephone with DHHS Worker 1 who was present with
interviewee.
I interviewed Youth A via telephone on 9/27/22. Youth A reported she was afraid of Staff
1. Youth A reported it was shift change and Staff 1 said, “Shut up ugly” and then stated
she was going to “stab me in my throat”. Youth A reported that Staff 2 attempted to stop
her. Youth A reported she was in her room and Staff 1 threatened to “beat her up”.
Youth A reported Staff 1 grabbed a knife from the kitchen and cut her on her chest with
the knife. Youth A reported that Staff 1 pushed her up against the wall and cut her.
4

Youth A reported that no one believes her, and the other youth tell her it is all in her
head.
I interviewed Staff 2. Staff 2 reported they were initially outside, and Youth A was
refusing to come inside when it was time. When they finally got her inside, Youth A went
into her room and began kicking the doors. Staff 2 reported when she went to do room
checks, she went into Youth A’s room and asked her if she was doing okay. Youth A
then got out of her room and Staff 2 asked for assistance. Staff 2 reported that when
Staff 1 came she held the room door open and was not looking at Staff 1 or Youth A.
Staff 2 reported she heard Youth A fall but didn’t know how she fell. Staff 2 reported
there was a basket of laundry in her room and Youth A told her she fell over the basket.
Staff 2 reported she didn’t see the incident but did write the incident report. Staff 2
reported she wrote in the incident report that Youth A fell over the basket although she
didn’t see it. Staff 2 reported that Youth A can be dramatic if she doesn’t get her way
and will blame others.
A follow up interview was conducted with Staff 2 after video observation was completed.
Staff 2 did not change her story to the incident.
I reviewed the Documentation Policy:
The Incident report needs to be completed in its entirety.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Interventions standards and prohibitions.
(1) An institution child caring institution shall establish and
follow written policies and procedures that prohibit the
following forms of intervention:
(a) any type of physical punishment including but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing
a youth on any part of their body.
ANALYSIS: Video observation concluded Staff 1 had pushed Youth A into
her room minimally twice. Pushing a youth is not an approved or
appropriate behavior management technique.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents' needs, implementation of treatment plans, and
discharge of residents.
ANALYSIS: The agency has a policy for documentation writing. The incident
report was not completed with all of the facts from the incident. It
was clear on the video that Staff 1 pushed Youth A into the
bedroom. It is also clear that the incident did not occur at
8:40pm but at 8:10pm. Staff 2 added details to the report that
she did not witness through her own omission.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
6

ANALYSIS: Staff 1 was hired on 1/27/20. Her most recent Performance e
Evaluation noted areas of improvement in reading client
centered safety interventions, professionalism, and handling
crisis situations. Staff 1 was provided with a written warning for
leaving a crisis situation and a memo for not using de-escalation
techniques outlined in TCI. Staff 1 had received trainings, a
warning, and goals from her supervisor to perform better, but
was unable to perform her duties as assigned.
Staff 2 has completed all trainings required and was unable to
fulfill her position as assigned. Staff 2 lied to the investigators,
by stating she did not see anything between Youth A and Staff
1, although the video clearly shows Staff 2 standing in the direct
vicinity of Staff 1 and Youth A and visually facing them during
the incident. Staff 2 also omitted information on her written
incident reports and added information that she did not actually
see.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that the license remain unchanged. Upon acceptance of an
approved CAP.
